attributes.action: Non-payment of child maintenance a criminal offence with custodial penalties
attributes.additional_details:
We believe current rules for non-payment of child maintenance do not hold non-paying parents fully responsible for their actions.
 
I believe that the Child Maintenance Service are failing parents who are not receiving the child maintenance they are due. Non-paying parents owe millions of pounds.
 
If a receiving parent can't afford to provide for their child they could face charges of neglect. Non-paying parents should face criminal penalties for failing to support their child, as this is also neglecting the child.
 
By making non-payment a criminal offence the police could take action against non-paying parents, hopefully helping ensure child maintenance is paid.
attributes.background: To make non-payment of child maintenance a criminal offence, with custodial penalties for offenders.
